title: History of The Rt Hon Lord Cameron - GOV.UK

quotes: David Cameron served as Prime Minister from 2010 to 2016, leading Britain’s first coalition government in nearly 70 years

Born
9 October 1966, London

Dates in office
2010 to 2016
He became MP for Witney in 2001 and within four years he was elected as Conservative Party Leader
Following the 2010 general election, David Cameron became Prime Minister on 11 May 2010, forming a coalition government between the Conservative Party and the Liberal Democrats.

organizations.name: Eton College
quotes: David Cameron was educated at Eton College and Brasenose College, Oxford, studying politics, philosophy and economics.

organizations.name: Brasenose College, Oxford
quotes: David Cameron was educated at Eton College and Brasenose College, Oxford, studying politics, philosophy and economics.

organizations.name: Conservative research department
quotes: After graduating he joined the Conservative research department where he worked for Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and her successor John Major.

organizations.name: Treasury
quotes: He was later appointed a special adviser in government, first at the Treasury and then at the Home Office, before joining the media company Carlton Communications, where he worked for seven years, serving on the management board.

organizations.name: Home Office
quotes: He was later appointed a special adviser in government, first at the Treasury and then at the Home Office, before joining the media company Carlton Communications, where he worked for seven years, serving on the management board.

organizations.name: Carlton Communications
quotes: He was later appointed a special adviser in government, first at the Treasury and then at the Home Office, before joining the media company Carlton Communications, where he worked for seven years, serving on the management board.

organizations.name: National Citizen Service
quotes: David Cameron is Chairman of Patrons at National Citizen Service, the UK’s flagship youth development programme that he personally founded while leader of the opposition.

organizations.name: Alzheimer’s Research UK
quotes: He is also President of Alzheimer’s Research UK and, together with former US Secretary of State, John Kerry, co-chairs Pew Bertarelli Ocean Ambassadors.

organizations.name: Pew Bertarelli Ocean Ambassadors
quotes: He is also President of Alzheimer’s Research UK and, together with former US Secretary of State, John Kerry, co-chairs Pew Bertarelli Ocean Ambassadors.

organizations.name: ONE campaign
quotes: He also sits on the Board of the ONE campaign.

organizations.name: Conservative Party
quotes: He became MP for Witney in 2001 and within four years he was elected as Conservative Party Leader seeking to remodel the Conservative party with a new and distinct agenda.

organizations.name: Liberal Democrats
quotes: Following the 2010 general election, David Cameron became Prime Minister on 11 May 2010, forming a coalition government between the Conservative Party and the Liberal Democrats.
